Description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATIONIS TO DE-OB REMAINING FUNDING AND TO CLOSE GRANT OUT.
TO CLOSE OUT THE PORT AUTHORITY OF NY AND NJ GRANT.
RICHMOND MARINE TERMINAL BARGE SERVICE OPTIMIZATION PROJECT

AWARD PURPOSE THE PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE PORTS FLEET OF SPECIALIZED CONTAINER YARD EQUIPMENT. THE EQUIPMENT TO BE PURCHASED INCLUDES TWO 40 TON LOADED CONTAINER HANDLERS THREE 10 TON EMPTY CONTAINER HANDLERS FIVE 5.5 TON FORKLIFTS ONE 180 FOOT BOOM LIFT NINE CONTAINER YARD TRACTOR TRAILERS AND TWO 40 PLUG MOBILE REEFER GENERATORS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THE PROJECT IS FOR THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT WITH THE FOLLOWING SPECIFICATIONS OR OF SIMILAR SPECIFICATIONS BASED ON MARKET AVAILABILITY TWO 40 TON LOADED CONTAINER HANDLERS LIFT CAPACITY 80000 LBS. STACKING HEIGHT MUST BE ABLE TO STACK 4 HIGH OF 9 6 ISO CONTAINER ENGINE DIESEL TIER 3 OR BETTER SPREAD OPEN FROM 20 40 45 THREE 10 TON EMPTY CONTAINER HANDLERS LIFT CAPACITY 15000 LBS. STACKING HEIGHT MUST BE ABLE TO STACK 4 HIGH OF 9 6 ISO CONTAINER ENGINE DIESEL TIER 3 OR BETTER SPREADER SINGLE LIFT WITH VERTICAL TWIST LOCK OPEN FROM 20 40 4 5 FIVE 5 5 TON FORKLIFTS LIFT CAPACITY 11000 LBS. HEIGHT LOWERED MUST BE ABLE TO ENTER A STANDARD 8 6 ISO CONTAINER ENGINE DIESEL TIER 3 OR BETTER FORK ADJUSTMENT SIDE SHIFT INDIVIDUAL AND DUAL ONE 180 FT BOOM LIFT PLATFORM HEIGHT 180 FT PLATFORM CAPACITY RESTRICTED 1000 LBS. PLATFORM CAPACITY UNRESTRICTED 500 LBS. NINE CONTAINER YARD TRACTOR TRAILERS ENGINE DIESEL TIER IV REAR AXLE 42000 LBS MINIMUM FRONT AXLE 12000 LBS MINIMUM FIFTH WHEEL 80000 LBS MINIMUM LIFTING CYLINDER HYDRAULIC 63000 LBS MINIMUM TWO 40 PLUG MOBILE REEFER GENERATORS RECEPTACLE PLUG MODEL 40 PLUG.  DELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOMES WITHIN ECONOMIC COMPETITIVENESS TEU MOVEMENTS OVER THE PROJECT STUDY AREA.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY PORT AUTHORITY OF GUAM. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NONE.

THE AMH GRANT FUNDING WILL BE APPLIED TOWARDS THE CUSTOMIZATION CONSTRUCTION PURCHASE AND DELIVERY OF A BARGE. COMPONENT 1BARGE ACQUISITION THE PURCHASE OF A BARGE FOR THE USE ON THE MARITIME TRANSPORTATION ISLAND SERVICE ROUTE FROM CEIBA TO VIEQUES AND CULEBRA. THE BARGE DIMENSIONS WILL CONSIST OF A BARGE WITH THE LENGTH OF 250FT AND WIDTH OF 72FT AND DRAFT SIZE OF 4FT WITH THE CAPABILITY TO CARRY CARGO 63.5FT WIDE BY 210FT LONG.

AWARD PURPOSE THE PROJECT WILL FUND ACQUISITION OF TWO TYPES OF EQUIPMENT SHIP MODULE STANDS AND HEAVY-DUTY RAMPS THAT WILL FACILITATE THE SAFE SUSTAINABLE AND EFFICIENT TRANSFER OF PROJECT CARGOES FROM SHORE TO VESSEL AND BACK TO SHORE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED THE PROJECT COMPRISES TWO COMPONENTS TO FACILITATE THE SAFE SUSTAINABLE AND EFFICIENT TRANSFER OF PROJECT CARGOES FROM SHORE TO VESSEL AND BACK TO SHORE SHIP MODULE STANDS AND HEAVY DUTY RAMPS THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO PROCURE THE EQUIPMENT IN BOTH COMPONENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL BIDDING RULES. HOWEVER IF NO ACCEPTABLE BID IS RECEIVED THE RECIPIENT MAY CONSIDER IN HOUSE FABRICATION OF THE EQUIPMENT WITH MARADS CONSENT. COMPONENT 1 SHIP MODULE STANDS ACQUISITION OF 38 LARGE AND 6 SMALL STEEL STANDS TO SUPPORT SHIP MODULES WHEN PLACED ON SOLID GROUND AND DURING TRANSPORTATION BY BARGE. EACH SHIP MODULE STAND WILL BE COMPRISED OF A TRESTLE AND SIX OF THE STANDS WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH TWO ADJUSTABLE CRADLES ON EACH SIDE 24 TOTAL TO PROVIDE ANGULAR CRADLE SUPPORT DURING MODULE MOVEMENT.  COMPONENT 2 HEAVY DUTY RAMPS ACQUISITION OF TWO HEAVY DUTY RAMPS TO FACILITATE THE TRANSFER OF SHIP MODULES BETWEEN SHORE AND BARGE. DELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOMES WITHIN ECONOMIC COMPETITIVENESS PROJECT CARGO MOVEMENTS TRUCKLOAD EQUIVALENTS OVER PROJECT STUDY AREA.  WITHIN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS THE MEASURE WILL QUANTIFY THE EMISSIONS AND FUEL CONSUMED BY THE MARINE HIGHWAY SERVICE WHICH WHEN SUBTRACTED FROM TOTAL TRUCK MILES ELIMINATED WILL RESULT IN A NEW SAVINGS IN EMISSIONS AND ENERGY CONSUMPTION.  HIGHWAY MILE SAVINGS SAVINGS CALCULATED BASED ON THE ELIMINATION OF HIGHWAY MILES THAT EACH CONTAINER WOULD HAVE TRAVELED ON SURFACE ROADS. INTENDED BENEFICIARY FINCANTIERI MARINE GROUP. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NONE.

THIS GRANT FUNDS THE PROJECT THAT WILL BE USED FOR THE ACQUISITION OF TWO AMERICAN MADE REACH STACKERS FOR THE BALZANO MARINE TERMINAL AT THE PORT OF CAMDEN NJ.  COMPONENT 1 ACQUISITION OF REACH STACKERS THE PURCHASE OF TWO AMERICAN-MADE REACH STACKERS INCLUDING INBOUND FREIGHT ASSEMBLY LABOR  ALL NECESSARY RENTALS FORKLIFT FREIGHT AND GRANT ADMINISTRATION.

1. AWARD PURPOSE THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE FINAL VESSEL DESIGN TO DEVELOP A NEW MODERN EFFICIENT AND CLEANER FERRYBOAT DESIGN. THE FINAL DESIGN WILL BE USED TO COMPLETE THE DESIGN PROCESS AND TO PROVIDE THE SHIPYARD THE DOCUMENTS WITH WHICH TO OBTAIN BIDS FOR CONSTRUCTION. 2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED DURING CONTRACT DESIGN THE CONSULTANT WILL PREPARE PLANS SPECIFICATIONS AND ESTIMATES. THE CONTRACT DESIGN PACKAGE WILL INCLUDE VESSEL ARRANGEMENTS STRUCTURAL DESIGN AND ANALYSIS PROPULSION SYSTEM ARRANGEMENT DESIGN AND SPECIFICATION ELECTRICAL SYSTEM ARRANGEMENT DESIGN AND SPECIFICATION SHIPBOARD ELECTRONICS AND CONTROL SYSTEM DESIGN DESIGN ARRANGEMENT AND SPECIFICATION OF AUXILIARY AND PIPING SYSTEMS DESIGN ARRANGEMENT AND SPECIFICATION OF OUTFIT AND FURNISHINGS
TECHNICAL ANALYSES OF SHIP PERFORMANCE INCLUDING WEIGHT HYDROSTATICS SPEED POWERING ENDURANCE STABILITY ADMEASUREMENT AND REFINEMENT OF THE CONSTRUCTION COST ESTIMATE TECHNICAL ANALYSES AND CALCULATIONS TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS FOR THE VESSEL MASTER EQUIPMENT LIST CONTRACTOR WILL TURN OUT A COMPLETE AND ROBUST CONTRACT DESIGN PACKAGE INCLUDING MORE THAN 50 DRAWINGS. THESE WILL FULFILL THE DESIGN REQUIREMENTS FOR A U.S. FLAG PASSENGER VESSEL REGULATED UNDER CHAPTER I  SUBCHAPTER H OF SECTION 46 OF THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS WITH STABILITY STANDARDS FOR OPERATION ON LAKES  BAYS AND SOUNDS. THE VESSEL WILL BE AMERICAN BUREAU OF SHIPPING ABS CLASSED SO THE DESIGN WILL BE DEVELOPED USING THE ABS RULES AND GUIDES AND SUBMITTED TO ABS FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. 3. DELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOMES THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS LISTED IN THE GRANT AGREEMENT 4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY DELAWARE RIVER & BAY AUTHORITY 5. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NONE

THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF TWO PURPOSE BUILT BARGES. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE RECIPIENT TO TRANSPORT UP TO 56,000 CONTAINERS ANNUALLY TO AND FROM THE SURROUNDING PORTS AND PETROCHEMICAL COMPLEXES.
